issue.title: Stack Overflow Report Issue
issue.body:
### Problem Statement

continuing #2988 can Stack overflow / buffer overflow crash also get the issue ticket?
I image it will look likes image below, because neighbor application has it 😅
![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/assets/101620997/30acdec7-5eb5-4117-9473-af988cd6b448)


### Solution Brainstorm

actually I expect the issue ticket will looks the same like the other "uncaught exception" ticket. So I think you can develop from that ticket code...

comment.body: After we ship #3009 in the next version, the issue should correctly show up on the dashboard after you'll update the SDK to a newer version. We just haven't released it yet, so please look out for the next version of the SDK (should be shipped next week).

issue.title: In-app includes don't work when minification is enabled
issue.body:
### Integration

sentry-android

### Build System

Gradle

### AGP Version

8.1.0

### Proguard

Enabled

### Version

6.25.0

### Steps to Reproduce

Enable in-app includes

```kotlin
SentryAndroid.init(this) { opts ->
    opts.dsn = "DSN HERE"
    opts.addInAppInclude("co.mopo")
}
```

and enable minification

```gradle
android {
    // ...

    buildTypes {
        release {
            debuggable = false
            minifyEnabled = true
            shrinkResources = true
            proguardFiles(getDefaultProguardFile("proguard-android-optimize.txt"), "proguard-rules.pro")
        }
    }
}
```

### Expected Result

Stack traces should highlight the stack lines from code within the `com.example` package, and collapse other stack lines.

### Actual Result

All stack lines are displayed equally.

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/assets/7407345/578ed081-b743-4561-9b57-820e3c097938)

I had a look at where `SentryOptions.getInAppIncludes()` gets used, and it appears that in-app includes are processed client-side:

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/blob/93a76ca3ed5e22b37a521784f4b601668bfa7e07/sentry/src/main/java/io/sentry/SentryStackTraceFactory.java#L46-L48

For this to work it seems like there needs to be a way to have the backend process them instead, because unlike the client, it has access to the source maps. Currently the client must be seeing all those `co.mopo` packages as `a.b` or something, so it thinks there are no in-app packages present in the trace.

issue.title: In-app includes don't work when minification is enabled
issue.body:
### Integration

sentry-android

### Build System

Gradle

### AGP Version

8.1.0

### Proguard

Enabled

### Version

6.25.0

### Steps to Reproduce

Enable in-app includes

```kotlin
SentryAndroid.init(this) { opts ->
    opts.dsn = "DSN HERE"
    opts.addInAppInclude("co.mopo")
}
```

and enable minification

```gradle
android {
    // ...

    buildTypes {
        release {
            debuggable = false
            minifyEnabled = true
            shrinkResources = true
            proguardFiles(getDefaultProguardFile("proguard-android-optimize.txt"), "proguard-rules.pro")
        }
    }
}
```

### Expected Result

Stack traces should highlight the stack lines from code within the `com.example` package, and collapse other stack lines.

### Actual Result

All stack lines are displayed equally.

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/assets/7407345/578ed081-b743-4561-9b57-820e3c097938)

I had a look at where `SentryOptions.getInAppIncludes()` gets used, and it appears that in-app includes are processed client-side:

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/blob/93a76ca3ed5e22b37a521784f4b601668bfa7e07/sentry/src/main/java/io/sentry/SentryStackTraceFactory.java#L46-L48

For this to work it seems like there needs to be a way to have the backend process them instead, because unlike the client, it has access to the source maps. Currently the client must be seeing all those `co.mopo` packages as `a.b` or something, so it thinks there are no in-app packages present in the trace.

comment.body: Cool, if that's working for you I'm gonna close the issue. We are tracking the other improvement I mentioned separately. Thanks!

issue.title: The number of Crashes and ANRs has increased

labels.name: Sync: Jira
labels.description: apply to auto-create a Jira shadow ticket

issue.body: ### Environment How do you use Sentry? - Self-hosted 22.11.0, 23.2.0 Which version of the SDK? - 1.2.0, 1.5.0 How did you install the package? (Git-URL, Assetstore) - Git-URL Which version of Unity? - 2021.3.25f1, 2020.3.46f1 Is this happening in Unity (editor) or on a player like Android, iOS, Windows? - Android ### Actual Result Since September 11, the number of Crashes and ANRs has increased significantly. ### Any logs or screenshots ┆Issue is synchronized with this [Jira Improvement](https://getsentry.atlassian.net/browse/FEEDBACK-1949) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

issue.title: usrivastava92/Ignore child exceptions if parent is ignored
issue.body:
## :scroll: Description
The Java SDK does not ignore child exceptions even if the parent exception class is added in `SentryOptions.ignoredExceptionsForType` set


## :bulb: Motivation and Context
Closes https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/issues/2015

## :green_heart: How did you test it?
Unit Tests

## :pencil: Checklist
<!--- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->

- [x] I reviewed the submitted code.
- [x] I added tests to verify the changes.
- [x] No new PII added or SDK only sends newly added PII if `sendDefaultPII` is enabled.
- [ ] I updated the docs if needed.
- [ ] Review from the native team if needed.
- [x] No breaking change or entry added to the changelog.
- [x] No breaking change for hybrid SDKs or communicated to hybrid SDKs.


## :crystal_ball: Next steps

issue.title: Ignoring an Exception class does not ignore its children
issue.body:
### Problem Statement

In .NET ignoring an Exception also ignores all of the Exceptions child classes. In Java only the class explicitly added to the list of ignored exceptions will be ignored.

### Solution Brainstorm

We could align with .NET and also ignore subclasses.

comment.body: hi @adinauer I have raised a PR to fix this, please review it and let me know if anything should be changed 🙂  Thanks

issue.title: In-app includes don't work when minification is enabled
issue.body:
### Integration

sentry-android

### Build System

Gradle

### AGP Version

8.1.0

### Proguard

Enabled

### Version

6.25.0

### Steps to Reproduce

Enable in-app includes

```kotlin
SentryAndroid.init(this) { opts ->
    opts.dsn = "DSN HERE"
    opts.addInAppInclude("co.mopo")
}
```

and enable minification

```gradle
android {
    // ...

    buildTypes {
        release {
            debuggable = false
            minifyEnabled = true
            shrinkResources = true
            proguardFiles(getDefaultProguardFile("proguard-android-optimize.txt"), "proguard-rules.pro")
        }
    }
}
```

### Expected Result

Stack traces should highlight the stack lines from code within the `com.example` package, and collapse other stack lines.

### Actual Result

All stack lines are displayed equally.

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/assets/7407345/578ed081-b743-4561-9b57-820e3c097938)

I had a look at where `SentryOptions.getInAppIncludes()` gets used, and it appears that in-app includes are processed client-side:

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/blob/93a76ca3ed5e22b37a521784f4b601668bfa7e07/sentry/src/main/java/io/sentry/SentryStackTraceFactory.java#L46-L48

For this to work it seems like there needs to be a way to have the backend process them instead, because unlike the client, it has access to the source maps. Currently the client must be seeing all those `co.mopo` packages as `a.b` or something, so it thinks there are no in-app packages present in the trace.

comment.body: Ah I hadn't seen that! Looks perfect, thank you

issue.title: In-app includes don't work when minification is enabled
issue.body:
### Integration

sentry-android

### Build System

Gradle

### AGP Version

8.1.0

### Proguard

Enabled

### Version

6.25.0

### Steps to Reproduce

Enable in-app includes

```kotlin
SentryAndroid.init(this) { opts ->
    opts.dsn = "DSN HERE"
    opts.addInAppInclude("co.mopo")
}
```

and enable minification

```gradle
android {
    // ...

    buildTypes {
        release {
            debuggable = false
            minifyEnabled = true
            shrinkResources = true
            proguardFiles(getDefaultProguardFile("proguard-android-optimize.txt"), "proguard-rules.pro")
        }
    }
}
```

### Expected Result

Stack traces should highlight the stack lines from code within the `com.example` package, and collapse other stack lines.

### Actual Result

All stack lines are displayed equally.

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/assets/7407345/578ed081-b743-4561-9b57-820e3c097938)

I had a look at where `SentryOptions.getInAppIncludes()` gets used, and it appears that in-app includes are processed client-side:

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/blob/93a76ca3ed5e22b37a521784f4b601668bfa7e07/sentry/src/main/java/io/sentry/SentryStackTraceFactory.java#L46-L48

For this to work it seems like there needs to be a way to have the backend process them instead, because unlike the client, it has access to the source maps. Currently the client must be seeing all those `co.mopo` packages as `a.b` or something, so it thinks there are no in-app packages present in the trace.

comment.body:
hi @angusholder, yes it's a known problem, for now you could circumvent this via defining [server-side stacktrace rules](https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/android/enhance-errors/proguard/#in-app-frames) (they apply _after_  deobfuscation has happened), you can see them a "server-side inAppIncludes". 

We'd still like to improve this behavior by at least setting in-app to the app package name by default after deobufscation, but if you have your own in-app includes, the docs I linked would be the way to go.

```gradle
}
```

### Expected Result

Stack traces should highlight the stack lines from code within the `com.example` package, and collapse other stack lines.

### Actual Result

All stack lines are displayed equally.

![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/assets/7407345/578ed081-b743-4561-9b57-820e3c097938)

https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/blob/93a76ca3ed5e22b37a521784f4b601668bfa7e07/sentry/src/main/java/io/sentry/SentryStackTraceFactory.java#L46-L48

For this to work it seems like there needs to be a way to have the backend process them instead, because unlike the client, it has access to the source maps. Currently the client must be seeing all those `co.mopo` packages as `a.b` or something, so it thinks there are no in-app packages present in the trace.

issue.title: Event Duration Statistical error
issue.body: ### Integration sentry-android ### Build System Gradle ### AGP Version 6.5 ### Proguard Enabled ### Version 6.25.0 ### Steps to Reproduce Hello, after upgrading Sentry to 6.25.0, the Event Duration that requires the page has been particularly impressive for nearly a minute. I specifically searched for a sample and found that the starting statistical time for events is from the start of application startup. Here is a screenshot: Do you know what caused this? ### Expected Result Event Duration 140ms ### Actual Result This is the log [json.txt](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/files/12923739/json.txt)

issue.title: Event Duration Statistical error
issue.body: ### Integration sentry-android ### Build System Gradle ### AGP Version 6.5 ### Proguard Enabled ### Version 6.25.0 ### Steps to Reproduce Hello, after upgrading Sentry to 6.25.0, the Event Duration that requires the page has been particularly impressive for nearly a minute. I specifically searched for a sample and found that the starting statistical time for events is from the start of application startup. Here is a screenshot: Do you know what caused this? ### Expected Result Event Duration 140ms ### Actual Result This is the log [json.txt](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/files/12923739/json.txt)

comment.body:
OneClickLoginDialogActivity is an Activity。It's just a problem with naming。
Can you explain your application startup behavior again? What does this mean?
The user simply clicks on the application icon on the desktop. Since they go to the Splash page, the declaration cycle of each activity can be seen in the JSON file

issue.title: Event Duration Statistical error
issue.body: ### Integration sentry-android ### Build System Gradle ### AGP Version 6.5 ### Proguard Enabled ### Version 6.25.0 ### Steps to Reproduce Hello, after upgrading Sentry to 6.25.0, the Event Duration that requires the page has been particularly impressive for nearly a minute. I specifically searched for a sample and found that the starting statistical time for events is from the start of application startup. Here is a screenshot: Do you know what caused this? ### Expected Result Event Duration 140ms ### Actual Result This is the log [json.txt](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/files/12923739/json.txt)

comment.body:
OneClickLoginDialogActivity is an Activity。It's just a problem with naming。
Can you explain your application startup behavior again? What does this mean?
The user simply clicks on the application icon on the desktop. Since they go to the Splash page, the declaration cycle of each activity can be seen in the JSON file

issue.title: Sentry Room integration breaks Room Kotlin CodeGen
issue.body:
### Integration

sentry-android

### Build System

Gradle

### AGP Version

8.1.2

### Proguard

Enabled

### Version

6.32.0

### Steps to Reproduce

- set up a project with `androidx.room:room-*:2.6.0`
- use KSP and set [`room.generateKotlin` to true](https://developer.android.com/jetpack/androidx/releases/room#2.6.0)
- build project with R8 enabled

### Expected Result

Compilation should succeed

### Actual Result

R8 fails in Room Dao classes:
`R8: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot read field "d" because "<parameter1>" is null`

First I did not have Sentry in mind when we faced this issue. Therefore also check out the issue in the Android issue tracker created by me: https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/306360975

comment.body: Yes, I wanted to leave the same comment - I'd rather remove these `super` calls, not sure if they will mess up something, but since we're using a delegate, it should be fine. E.g. apache-commons also don't call super, but just delegate https://github.com/apache/commons-io/blob/43d3ac6cbdb419a1929870b04be181da20be7f03/src/main/java/org/apache/commons/io/input/ProxyInputStream.java#L119-L122

pull_request.title: Make sure to close all Closeable resources
pull_request.body:
## :scroll: Description
changed all stream operations to try-with-resources blocks
added super.close() to SentryFileInputStream and SentryFileOutputStream


## :bulb: Motivation and Context
Relates to https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-java/issues/2905
It is not fixed entirely, though. We have to investigate the native layer: removing it makes this issue disappear.


## :green_heart: How did you test it?


## :pencil: Checklist
<!--- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->

- [ ] I reviewed the submitted code.
- [ ] I added tests to verify the changes.
- [ ] No new PII added or SDK only sends newly added PII if `sendDefaultPII` is enabled.
- [ ] I updated the docs if needed.
- [ ] Review from the native team if needed.
- [ ] No breaking change or entry added to the changelog.
- [ ] No breaking change for hybrid SDKs or communicated to hybrid SDKs.


## :crystal_ball: Next steps

pull_request.title: Use PixelCopy API for capturing screenshots on API level 24+
pull_request.body:
## :scroll: Description
Use PixelCopy on newer devices, as it allows us to capture screenshots on background threads as well.

Right now we don't seem to have any tests for `ScreenshotUtils.java`, if you have an idea on how we could test this, I'm happy to add tests!  

## :bulb: Motivation and Context
Fixes https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-react-native/issues/3314
Closes #2916 

## :green_heart: How did you test it?


## :pencil: Checklist
<!--- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->

- [x] I reviewed the submitted code.
- [ ] I added tests to verify the changes.
- [ ] No new PII added or SDK only sends newly added PII if `sendDefaultPII` is enabled.
- [ ] I updated the docs if needed.
- [ ] Review from the native team if needed.
- [ ] No breaking change or entry added to the changelog.
- [ ] No breaking change for hybrid SDKs or communicated to hybrid SDKs.


## :crystal_ball: Next steps

comment.body: `l`: We could use `BuildInfoProvider` here and test it. You could take a look at `SentryGestureListenerClickTest` where we completely mock windows and decor views, and there's also [ShadowPixelCopy](https://github.com/robolectric/robolectric/blob/b0c04e9b34b66cd300448dd29b8ccc26b22f3f78/shadows/framework/src/main/java/org/robolectric/shadows/ShadowPixelCopy.java#L44) of robolectric that would be helpful

pull_request.title: Use PixelCopy API for capturing screenshots on API level 24+
pull_request.body:
## :scroll: Description
Use PixelCopy on newer devices, as it allows us to capture screenshots on background threads as well.

Right now we don't seem to have any tests for `ScreenshotUtils.java`, if you have an idea on how we could test this, I'm happy to add tests!  

## :bulb: Motivation and Context
Fixes https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-react-native/issues/3314
Closes #2916 

## :green_heart: How did you test it?
